p:
Lopinavir and ritonavir with a molecular weight of 629 and 721 Da respectively and their lipid solubility nature, are good candidates for excretion to milk during lactation period but their high plasma protein binding could limit this excretion. A comprehensive data is not available yet. It has been recommended that breastfeeding during lopinavir/ritonavir therapy is better to be avoided especially in developed countries.
